result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If Probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental agencies for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs on a schedule set forth by Probation & Parole.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime
PTAC, as a Party to a Crime
PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to criminal conduct.
2)Defendant shall notify Pepin County District Attorney's Office of any change of residence or employment.
3)Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician. ...
4)Defendant must submit to random drug and alcohol testing within 12 hours of hte request of the DA and pay all fees associated with testing.....
5)Upon execution of this agreement, the Defendant must report to the Pepin County Sheriff's Dept. to complete a drug test within 72 hours and pay all fees associated with testing.  ....
6)That L.W. not test positive for any controlled substances.  ....
7)The defendant shall cooperate with Pepin County Human Services, and comply with any recommendation set forth by the DHS regarding the care and custody of her children, namely L.W.
8)One month prior to completion of contract, defendant must contact Pepin County District Attorney's Office for a final interview.
9)Defendant must report in person as requested by the Pepin County District Attorney or other supervisor designated by him.
10) The defendant must follow the rules and regulations as set forth by probation, if applicable.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leah A. Kramer

records.addlTxt: 01:34 PM Defendant Leah A. Kramer appeared by video means w/o counsel. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not wish counsel.  State has had discussions with Ms. Kramer so the offer to Ms. Kramer by letter dated 2/17 is to plead to count 1 PTAC as repeater and ask sentence of 2 years probation; count 4 neglecting a child PTAC as repeater, enter into a DAGPA for 2 years and provided her a copy and has brought back the signed document today before court and think just got efiled.  If we proceed, State would file an Information same as criminal complaint and dismiss other counts. Court advises of right to attorney.  Defendant waives her right to an attorney.  Court finds defendant knowingly, voluntarily & intelligently waives her right to counsel in 22CF02.  Court advises defendant of right to PH.  Defendant waives her statutory right to a PH on record.  Court finds defendant knowingly, voluntarily & intelligently waives her to PH on counts 1 & 4.  Court reviews constitutional rights with defendant.  Court finds Ms. Kramer knowingly, voluntarily & intelligently waiving her constitutional rights.  Court advised defendant of right to conduct this hearing in person.  Defendant waives personal appearance and agrees to conduct this hearing by zoom.  Court advises defendant of charges in the Information that will soon be filed in count 1/max. penalties.  The complaint does not allege the prior conviction.  Defendant informs she does not have a prior conviction.  Attorney Seifert informs of the prior convictions.  Defendant agrees she has had the prior convictions stated by Mr. Seifert.  To count 1 possession of meth., defendant pleads guilty.  Court advises of charges in count 4/max. penalties.  To count 4 neglect of child as a repeater, defendant pleads guilty.  Court will accept your plea.  DRI counts 2 & 3.  State filed the DAGPA on count 4 important to note she understands the conditions and any violation of the conditions.  Court reviews the agreement with defendant.  Defendant pleads guilty to count 4.  Court will defer for a period of 2 years.  To allegation of meth as a repeater, defendant pleads guilty, court accepts your plea.  Conditions of probation:  No possession or consumption of controlled substance without a physician's prescription and cooperate with human services.  Court withholds sentence and place on 2 years probation; adhere to any CHIPS order; no possession or consumption of controlled substance without a physician's prescription.  Pay court costs on a schedule determined by your agent and submit to a DNA sample.  Advised of appeal rights.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:54 PM Defendant Leah A. Kramer appeared by video means. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Ms. Kramer appears without counsel, decided she didn't want an attorney and will represent herself.  State interested in visiting with her if she contact him to discuss her case.  Time limits for PH continue to be waived.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:49 PM Defendant Leah A. Kramer appeared by video means. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Defendant wishes time to contact an attorney.  Defendant confirms her address on file.  Defendant unemployed.  Contact the PD office and if not eligible, contact the Court and we will work with you to appoint an attorney, not a free attorney, she would have to repay the county back.  Attorney Schroeder of SPD office provides defendant the phone # to call.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:32 AM Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Leah A. Kramer appeared by video means in custody without counsel. Court informs Defendant of charges and  maximum penalties and gives Defendant their rights. DA informs Court of Defendant's criminal record and recommends $1000 signature bond with conditions. Court orders $1000 signature bond with conditions of no possession or consumption of controlled substances and/or alcohol and no entrance into bars/taverns except for employment.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession or consumption of controlled substances or alcohol.
No entrance into bars or taverns except for employment.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm. Given to Defendant while still in custody.
